title: Educational Blogging to Strengthen Reflective Learning in Computer-Assisted Language Education: Integrated Analysis of Grammar, Vocabulary, and Expression (K-12)

context.prior_knowledge: Experience using computer-assisted instructional tools, foundational language education concepts (grammar, vocabulary, reading comprehension, writing), experience designing learning activities in digital environments, and understanding of peer review processes
context.additional_context: A course for professionals in medical/legal/technical fields to strengthen elementary language education competencies. Emphasizes real-time interaction and reflective learning activities using mobile devices in BYOD environments. Focuses on improving learners’ language expressive abilities (speaking/writing), text analysis skills (reading comprehension/structural understanding), and vocabulary utilization.

learning_goals: Learners select two computer-assisted language learning activities (e.g., digital flashcards, language apps) via three weekly educational blogging sessions, analyzing each in terms of grammar, vocabulary, and expression using a structured template with three-step reflections (strengths/limitations/improvements).

Learners successfully complete a project applying language learning knowledge (e.g., reading strategies, writing skills, text structuring) to new educational contexts with ≥80% success, based on reflective thinking.
Learners demonstrate ≥2 instances of qualitative improvement in blogging content (e.g., text structuring, lexical diversity, contextual expressiveness) through peer feedback.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
